biography.content: Bartha Maria Knoppers, PhD (Comparative Medical Law), is a Full Professor and the Director of the Centre of Genomics and Policy, Faculty of Medicine, Human Genetics, McGill University, and holds the Canada Research Chair in Law and Medicine.  She is the founder of the Population Project in Genomics (P3G) and Society and CARTaGENE Quebec’s population biobank. Chair of the Ethics Working Party of the International Stem Cell Forum (2005- ); Co-Chair of the Sampling/ELSI Committee of the 1000 Genomes Project (2007-2014); Scientific Steering Committee Member of the International Cancer Genome Consortium (2009- ); Co-Chair, Regulatory and Ethics Working Group and Member, Steering Committee of the Global Alliance for Genomics and Health.  She holds four Doctorates Honoris Causa, is Fellow of the AAAS and the Canadian Academy Health Sciences; and Officer of the Order of Canada and of Quebec.  She received the “Prix Montréal In Vivo: Secteur des sciences de la vie et des technologies de la santé” in 2012.  In 2014, she was named “Great Montrealer”, Scientific Sector by the Board of Trade of Metropolitan Montreal, and in 2015 she received the Medal Paul-André Crépeau for her work in comparative medical law (The Canadian Bar Association).
